result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Herman Pope Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Herman Pope Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Brian Thomas Coe appeared by video for Herman Pope Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Coe has received discovery and/or an offer and needs to discuss with the defendant. Defense would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1. This hearing will be heard via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Herman Pope Jr in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Coe in court for Herman Pope Jr.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD. Status conference held.  Atty. Coe just found out he was appointed to this case and requests a status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Herman Pope in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a pretrial conference. Defendant appears without counsel. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Ryan Coe to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month beginning on 09-01-2022 and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Case remains calendared in Br. 01.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 7/8/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Oral No Contact Order with Explorium Brew Pub.

Defendant Herman Pope in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 01.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-6-2022 @1:30p
